availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas W. Pickering (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Minerva Pickering. Father of Martha Pickering, John M. Pickering, Napoleon B. Pickering, Sarah Pickering, Malachi Pickering, Thomas Pickering, Rodolphus R. Pickering, and Minerva Pickering. Constable in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860. High sheriff of Caldwell County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 377A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 799.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 25.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 224B-225A.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Wills, 1809-1967; Vol A-B, 1809-1889, p. 321-22.
KYR-0001-020-0017.
